rh:help.rh:title: Create a node to contain literal/verbatim content

rh:description.para: This is a utility function for users who want to provide their own facilities for converting R objects to HTML, FO, Docbook, and generally XML. This allows programmers to use this function for all formats when inserting output from R literally. The function is not generally intended for use by R users just processing documents with existing style files and R conversion.

rh:arg.para: an object of class DynamicTarget which is used to identify the format of the document being generated. This is used to dispatch methods based on the different formats such as HTML, FO, LaTeX, and so on.
text or XML nodes to be placed as the contents/childre of the verbatim node.
the parent XML node of this new verbatim node.
the XMLInternalDocument object which is to "house" the new node. If the parent argument is specified, the document is not necessary.

a logical value indicating whether to add the content within an XML CDATA construct to avoid interpreting special XML-related characters such as < and & as XML, but literally. This is the safe thing to do.
